result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby Lee Cruickshank was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into Locked Vehicle [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.11.
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: AS TO COUNTS ONE AND TWO, EACH COUNT:  Concurrent with each other. Credit for 140 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Not to commit any new offenses.

Obtain AODA asessment and follow up treatment.
*Conditions of Extended Supervision apply to both counts/case.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO COUNT ONE AND TWO, EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge, all remaining costs and surcharges.  If not paid, convert to civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: AS STATED IN COUNT ONE.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bobby Lee Cruickshank in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Bobby Lee Cruickshank in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Bobby Lee Cruickshank not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.    Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Bobby Lee Cruickshank not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bobby Lee Cruickshank in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request additional time.  Status conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Daniel J

Defendant Bobby Lee Cruickshank in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Bobby Lee Cruickshank in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
